abstract: City University of New York reaches tentative contract agreement with Professional Staff Congress, university's largest union, after six-year impasse; agreement, which comes as threats of walkout loomed, includes salary increases, bonuses and longer appointments for adjunct faculty members; deal must still be approved by CUNY's board of trustees as well as union members.
lead_paragraph: The agreement would give 25,000 faculty and staff members 10.41 percent compounded salary increases over seven years, among other things.

headline.main: Tentative Contract Deal at CUNY Ends Stalemate and Strike Threat
headline.print_headline: CUNY Deal  on Contract  After Threat  of a Walkout

snippet: The agreement would give 25,000 faculty and staff members 10.41 percent compounded salary increases over seven years, among other things.
